attributes.action: Catering contracts for schools in West Sussex include Halal meals
attributes.additional_details:
Vegatarian meals in schools are very bland due to their low sugar, fat and salt content, & Muslim children are opting for lunchboxes, which are extremely high in fat, sugar & salt.
The BAME community (of which the vast majority of Muslim's come from), are at higher risk of health problems such as diabetes & high cholesterol. These all have a link to poor diet and obesity
With this change; a healthier start in life, it will ease pressure on our healthcare now, & in the future.
attributes.background:
We call upon West Sussex County Council to ensure that any future catering
contract for schools in the County includes the provision of Halal meals for those that need it.

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions about catering contracts are a matter for individual schools and local authorities, not the UK Government or Parliament.

You could raise your issue with a local councillor who represents you. You can find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them, by entering your post code here:
https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

You can also petition West Sussex County Council directly: https://www.westsussex.gov.uk/about-the-council/have-your-say/petitions-to-the-county-council/
